result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Case called: 9:52 a.m.
Clerk Micki.
INCLUDES 19CM1358 and 22CM1019.

State appears by ADA Hannah Runde; Defendant appears in person, in custody from the MCJ, with Attorney Peter Rotter.

Date and time set for a JPTC.

ADA Rundes notes a global offer needs to be provided to defense.
Atty Rotter makes statement - was just appointed on these cases. Plans on filing a bond modification.
COURT recites next court dates/times on the record.

NEXT DATE >>
PTC w/JA - 11/1/22 at 10:50 a.m. 
Motion Hearing (bond modification) - 11/9/22 at 1:15 p.m.

ADJ: 9:57 a.m.

Clerk: Amanda. 
Case called at 9:12 am.
INCLUDES: 19CM1358 and 22CM1019. 

Defendant appears from MCJ, pro se. 

A.J.B. sworn and testifies. 
Court questions defendant RE: Employment/Income. 
Court appoints Attorney Peter Rotter @ $100/hr. not to exceed $700 without further order of the Court. 


Adj: 9:14 am.

Clerk: Heather. 
Case called: 3:12 p.m. 
INCLUDES: 19CM1358, 22CM1019.
State appears by ADA Lacey Coonen.  Defendant appears from MCJ via Zoom, with Atty Greg Venturini, in person.

COURT QUASHES WARRANT. 

Date and time set for initial appearance in 22CM1019. VRCW.  
Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction. 
Court questions deft re: complaint and rights.
Advised Right of Counsel. 
PLEA: NOT GUILTY on CM's

COURT ORDERS: $500.00 cash bond. 

CONDITIONS: 
- No contact with victim(s): T.R.H., D.L.R. 
- Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol.  
- Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release.  Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 3 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.  

DATES:
IH: 10/27/22 @ 9:00 a.m. Br. 5. 
JPTC: 10/28/22 @ 9:30 a.m.
